info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 05 at 2:26PM MDT until June 05 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE MCBRIDE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms moving south to southeast producing heavy rain over the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road particularly near the south end of Gavilan Canyon Road near the junction with Meander, Homestead Loop and downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the McBride Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
